Intervals

Module Summary

Module with code related to musical intervals.

Imports

notes: Import the classes and exception of the module.

Global variables

intervals.ALL_INTERVAL_NAMES: list[str | tuple]

All names of intervals with enharmonics in tuples.

intervals.ALL_INTERVAL_NAMES_UNPACKED: list[str]

All names of intervals in order.

Exceptions

InvalidIntervalAttributeError: Raised when an interval’s invalid.

Functions

all_about_interval(): Return a message with data on an interval.

interval_input(): Receive input and transforms into an interval.

get_note_interface(): Bridge between get_second_note and user.

get_name_interface(): Bridge between get_name() and user.

run(): Run the module as a script.

Classes

Interval: Defines intervals and their methods.

Exceptions

exception intervals.InvalidIntervalAttributeError(attr='', value='', message='Invalid attribute value for interval: ')

Raised when there’s an invalid setting of an interval attribute.

This exception has parameters for identifying the attribute, the value and a custom message.

Functions

intervals.all_about_interval(interval: Interval) → str

Return a message containing information about an interval.

intervals.interval_input(message: str) → Interval

Handle the input of intervals’ names with a custom message.

intervals.get_note_interface() → Note

Interface the get_second_note() method with the user.

intervals.get_name_interface() → tuple[str]

Interface the get_name() method with the user.

intervals.run()

Run the module as a script.

Classes

Interval Summary

class intervals.Interval(name='', note1=<musicinpython.notes.Note object>, note2: ~musicinpython.notes.Note = '')

Class that defines musical intervals and their methods.

Attributes

name: str

The name of the interval (e.g.:”VII”).

note1: notes.Note

First note of the interval.

note2: notes.Note

Second note of the interval.

Methods

is_unison(): Check if interval is unison.

is_minor(): Check if interval is minor.

is_major(): Check if interval is major.

is_diminished(): Check if interval is diminished.

is_perfect(): Check if interval is perfect.

is_augmented(): Check if interval is augmented.

get_second_note(): Get the second note of the interval.

choose_name_for_interval(): Choose between two enharmonics.

get_name(): Get the name of the interval.

__init__(name='', note1=<musicinpython.notes.Note object>, note2: ~musicinpython.notes.Note = '')

Instantiate an interval.

Raises InvalidIntervalAttributeError if arguments are wrong type (note1 and note2) or not in appropriate list (name).

Parameters:

  • name (str) – Passed to name.

  • note1 (notes.Note) – Passed to note1.

  • note2 (notes.Note) – Passed to note2.

Interval Methods

Interval.is_unison() → bool

Check if interval is unison/octave.

Interval.is_minor() → bool

Check if interval is in list of minor intervals.

Interval.is_major() → bool

Check if interval is in list of major intervals.

Interval.is_diminished() → bool

Check if interval is in list of diminished intervals.

Interval.is_perfect() → bool

Check if interval is in list of perfect intervals.

Interval.is_augmented() → bool

Check if interval is in list of augmented intervals.

Interval.get_second_note()

Get the second note of the interval.

Generates a chromatic scale using notes.ChromaticScaleGenerator, then the index of the interval’s name in ALL_INTERVAL_NAMES on the generated scale to retrieve the second note.

Interval.choose_name_for_interval()

Choose between two enharmonics to name the interval.

Interval.get_name()

Get the name of the interval based on its two notes.

First, generates a chromatic scale using notes.ChromaticScaleGenerator, then extracts the note names using a list comprehension. Afterwards, gets the index of the interval’s second note in the scale and use it on ALL_INTERVAL_NAMES to get the corresponding interval’s name, calling choose_name_for_interval() if the interval’s name has an enharmonic.
